image.altText: Three poker machines in a club with brightly coloured screens showing different gambling games, with three empty stools in front

props.synopsis: From late next year, cash and coins will no longer be inserted into gaming machines in Tasmania as new gambling reforms that focus on "harm minimisation" are introduced. So, how will this "cashless gaming" system work?

title.children: Tasmania will soon lead the nation with its cashless gaming system, but how will it work?

image.altText: Ben Yole holds bridle of a horse.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's top harness racing trainer has had his trainer's licence reinstated despite an active investigation into allegations of race fixing, team driving and animal welfare concerns.

title.children: Top harness racing trainer free to compete again despite race fixing and animal welfare claims

image.altText: Composite image of a man wearing a suit and tie, and an image of race horses and money

props.synopsis: Paul Montgomery was brought in by these brothers as a trusted friend to run the financial side of their business but as they made him general manager, he stole millions, was duchessed by gambling company VIPs and lost it all while on a multi-million dollar losing streak.

title.children: 'The Golden Goose' that cooked the books, a business and lifelong friendships as he gambled the millions he stole

image.altText: An older man in a hard hat and an orange Hi-Vis vest stands on a dock in front of the water.

props.synopsis: The project to deliver new Spirit of Tasmania vessels has led to another resignation at ferry operator TT-Line, with chief executive Bernard Dwyer absent from today's parliamentary inquiry.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania saga claims a third high-ranking official, as chief executive Bernard Dwyer resigns

image.altText: Angus Taylor, Jim Chalmers 20221026_192814850_iOS

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers launches an extraordinary broadside after failing to land an agreement with the Coalition on plans to reform the Reserve Bank of Australia.

title.children: Chalmers bombards Coalition with insults after Reserve Bank negotiations fall apart

image.altText: A young girl in a grey hoody kicks a yellow football passed a massive elm tree in dappled sunlight in front of a stadium.

props.synopsis: The redevelopment of York Park stadium in Tasmania's north has come to a standstill as the council stays split over a decision to remove an old elm tree to make way for a new centre-west stand.

title.children: Launceston council split on move to remove elm tree to redevelop York Park stadium

image.altText: Smiling man in a suit, stands holding the budget paper for 2023

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Treasurer Michael Ferguson announces a record $5.1 billion infrastructure spend days out from this year's state budget, despite a warning from an independent review.

title.children: Tasmania's treasurer unveils record infrastructure spend, opposite to warning in independent review

image.altText: The Princess of Wales smiles while looking at something in her hand in a leafy-green garden

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales confirms she is no longer receiving chemotherapy, and says she will return to a light program of external engagements in the coming months.

title.children: Princess of Wales no longer receiving chemotherapy and 'doing what I can to stay cancer free'

image.altText: A close up image of a man in a tie.

props.synopsis: A frustrated Jim Chalmers says he might have to turn to the Greens to keep reforms to the Reserve Bank alive. Follow live.

title.children: Treasurer to look at 'all options', including negotiations with Greens, to keep RBA reform alive

image.altText: A man and a woman looking over paperwork with a calculator and computer

props.synopsis: In the United States, Americans can split or average out their income with their partner to reduce the tax they pay. Could this be adopted in Australia?

title.children: 'So blatant it's bordering on laughable': Family trust accounts minimise tax, so why can't couples have a joint tax return?

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks into the camera with a pained expression.

props.synopsis: Alison Whitfield's husband Dave, a veteran medic with the Australian Defence Force, took his own life earlier this year. She desperately hopes other families do not have to experience the same pain.

title.children: The royal commission laid bare the anguish veterans face. Now their families say it's time to fix the system

image.altText: A man kneeling to the side of a motorcycle in front of a luxury car with a crushed front

props.synopsis: Four years after charges were dropped against the heir to the Red Bull empire over an alleged hit-and-run, eight people are under scrutiny, accused of helping him avoid court.

title.children: The Red Bull heir was accused of killing a cop. Now eight people who allegedly got him off the hook are on trial

image.altText: Shoppers walk through Pitt Street Mall

props.synopsis: With growth at the slowest pace in Australia since the recession of the early 1990s, we are now faced with an ongoing economic crisis in China — our biggest trading partner — and the prospect of a global economic slowdown.

title.children: Why the RBA will be forced to cut rates before year's end

image.altText: A girl with long hair is seen holding a phone while standing near a balcony overlooking a garden

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese vows to introduce legislation to ban children from accessing social media before the next election — but the age cut off is yet to be determined.

title.children: Social media ban for children to be introduced in next 12 months

image.altText: James Earl Jones arrives at the Tony Awards on June 12, 2016

props.synopsis: His agent, Barry McPherson, confirmed Jones died Monday morning at home in New York's Hudson Valley region.

title.children: Actor and voice of Darth Vader James Earl Jones dead at 93

image.altText: A smiling young man and a happy woman hug affectionately.

props.synopsis: Amid widespread elevated distress, Australia's new draft National Suicide Prevention Strategy, released today, focuses on a fundamental change to dealing with the social and economic factors behind feelings of hopelessness.

title.children: How a 'normal mum' and her desperate son found a lifeline during their darkest days

image.altText: A white woman with short brown hair looking into the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: Many neurodivergent people with eating disorders say traditional treatments haven't considered their unique needs. Now there's a push towards a more tailored approach.

title.children: Traditional treatment for eating disorders left a woman traumatised. She wants other neurodivergent people to know 'there's a way out'

image.altText: A still from a video appearing to show former SA Liberal leader David Speirs leaning over a plate and snorting.

props.synopsis: A video appearing to show former SA Liberal leader David Speirs leaning over and snorting from a plate has been published online, but he has reportedly told News Corp it is a deepfake and has described any suggestions of wrongdoing as "very troubling".

title.children: Video appears to show former SA Liberal leader snorting from plate, but he claims it is a deepfake

image.altText: A woman stands outside her home in pink

props.synopsis: This Queensland woman found the home she wanted, packed up and moved. But there was one problem — she was sold the property next door.

title.children: Woman sold the wrong house wants more regulation of property transactions

image.altText: People wading through chest high floodwaters

props.synopsis: The tropical cyclone is the strongest to hit the country in decades, with major industrial hubs in the country's north hit by torrential rains and flooding.

title.children: Northern Vietnam inundated in aftermath of Typhoon Yagi as death toll rises to at least 64

image.altText: A hollowed out old man wearing a suit and black glasses sits in court with two police officers standing next to him

props.synopsis: Former Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein, who is due in court this week, has emergency heart surgery after experiencing chest pains in a New York City jail.

title.children: Harvey Weinstein has emergency heart surgery in New York

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis:
Wall Street indices jump more than a point and the treasurer discusses new RBA legislation.

Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street indices jump more than a point, treasurer discusses RBA legislation, news on markets and business

image.altText: An eel looking at the camera side on

props.synopsis: Japanese researchers have captured a surprising escape tactic used by juvenile eels, and they aren't the only animal that can escape digestion.

title.children: Video shows eels have a back-up escape plan when they are eaten by a fish

image.altText: A drone shot of a suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: New Australian Housing and Urban Institute research has found that about 70 per cent of households have reported building quality problems. It also found that most of Australia's existing housing stock was energy-inefficient and of poor quality.

title.children: More than two-thirds of Australian homes have building issues, new report says

image.altText: A black silouhette of a person in front of a aqua club scene.

props.synopsis: It was meant to be a celebration, but these school leavers were left "numb" and "scared" after what they believed was needle spiking.

title.children: Graduates report needle spiking at Gold Coast and Byron Bay Schoolies events

image.altText: A baby in hospital with burns.

props.synopsis: The nine-month-old was seriously burned in the attack at Stones Corner on August 27 and had to have surgery.

title.children: Baby boy's family 'devastated' man accused of coffee attack fled country a day before police confirmed his identity

image.altText: A close up image of a woman with short brown hair against a black background.

props.synopsis: Minerals Council chief executive Tania Constable has warned the industry is in a precarious state, blaming "reckless" federal government industrial relations reforms, state "royalty raids", "onerous" looming environmental rules, and high energy costs.

title.children: 'Conflict has been brought upon us': Mining industry slams Albanese over industrial relations reform

image.altText: Mother and children together on a brown couch and smile at the camera, with both children leaning into their mother

props.synopsis: Finding the best school for a child can be a daunting decision for parents and one which experts say should be based on the individual learning style of each child.

title.children: Parents urged to identify their child's strengths to find the perfect school

image.altText: Aaron James is prepared by a doctor ahead of his partial face transplant.

props.synopsis: Scientists have found signs of retina function in an eye transplanted into a man a year ago — the first such operation involving a whole eye. The scientist who led the surgical team says the next step is understanding how to restore sight.

title.children: Scientists laud promising results from world's first whole eye transplant

image.altText: Josh Addo-Carr of the Bulldogs warming up before a match against the Raiders

props.synopsis: Canterbury will weigh up whether to name Josh Addo-Carr to play in this weekend's elimination final after he allegedly returned a positive roadside drug test.

title.children: Bulldogs to hold Addo-Carr talks amid confusion about alleged positive cocaine test

image.altText: An older, bearded man with grey hair stands amid a crowd of journalist.

props.synopsis: Graeme McBride says he wants to be able to sleep on a dry pillow and lay in a comfortable position without a broken neck and heart.

title.children: Injured dad who lost wife, daughter in Hunter Valley bus crash tells court of ongoing trauma

image.altText: Queensland Fire Department

props.synopsis: The LNP has referred serious allegations of rape, sexual harassment and domestic violence within the Queensland Fire Department to the state's corruption watchdog.

title.children: Allegations of rape and sexual harassment within Queensland Fire Department referred to corruption watchdog

image.altText: Q+A Housing Special panel

props.synopsis: The federal government is using the RBA as a “scapegoat” for mishandling the economy, the opposition says, as politicians are challenged on housing solutions.

title.children: Minister notes housing 'despair', opposition renews Chalmers attack

image.altText: A woman with glasses and a striped shirt looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A new state government campaign targets violence against teachers amid increasing reports of threats, bullying and violence against teachers and other school staff.

title.children: New campaign targets abuse against teachers, with some Queensland educators 'scared' by parental aggression

image.altText: Terry Buckley holds potatoes at his farm.

props.synopsis: Australian supermarkets have high standards for how a spud should look. Producers say the focus should be on the taste instead.

title.children: Skin-deep beauty standards for Australian potatoes leading to 'absurd' amount of waste
